welcome.title: Welcome to InnSight
welcome.subtitle: Your personal mental wellness companion.
welcome.what_is_innsight: Your daily companion for mental well-being

dashboard.no_entries: No mood entries yet. Start logging your moods!

mood.select_emotions: Select up to 3 emotions that reflect your current state
mood.why_feeling: Why do you feel this way?
mood.journal_placeholder: Write a few words about why you feel this way...

motivational.1: Acknowledging your emotions is a powerful step toward well-being.
motivational.2: Thank you for checking in with yourself today.
motivational.3: Each time you log your mood, you build emotional awareness.
motivational.4: Your feelings matter. Thank you for honoring them today.
motivational.5: Regular reflection helps you understand yourself better.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.message: The page you are looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

happy.name: Happy
happy.description: A feeling of pleasure and contentment.

joyful.name: Joyful
joyful.description: A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

loving.name: Loving
loving.description: Feeling affection or deep care for someone or something.

content.name: Content
content.description: In a state of peaceful happiness and satisfaction.

confident.name: Confident
confident.description: Feeling self-assured and certain about your abilities.

excited.name: Excited
excited.description: Feeling enthusiastic and eager about something.

blessed.name: Blessed
blessed.description: Feeling fortunate and grateful for what you have.

inspired.name: Inspired
inspired.description: Mentally stimulated to feel or do something creative.

celebrating.name: Celebrating
celebrating.description: Feeling joyful about a special achievement or occasion.

peaceful.name: Peaceful
peaceful.description: Free from disturbance; tranquil and calm.

neutral.name: Neutral
neutral.description: Neither positive nor negative; in the middle emotionally.

speechless.name: Speechless
speechless.description: So surprised or moved you cannot find words to respond.

expressionless.name: Expressionless
expressionless.description: Showing no emotion on your face or in your manner.

thinking.name: Thinking
thinking.description: Focused on thoughts, considering something deeply.

smirking.name: Smirking
smirking.description: Having a self-satisfied, conceited, or silly smile.

surprised.name: Surprised
surprised.description: Feeling astonished or taken aback by something unexpected.

confused.name: Confused
confused.description: Unable to think clearly or understand something.

unamused.name: Unamused
unamused.description: Not finding something funny or entertaining.

awkward.name: Awkward
awkward.description: Feeling uncomfortable, embarrassed, or out of place.

tired.name: Tired
tired.description: In need of sleep or rest; fatigued.

sleepy.name: Sleepy
sleepy.description: Ready or inclined to sleep; drowsy.

quiet.name: Quiet
quiet.description: Making little or no noise; mentally subdued.

curious.name: Curious
curious.description: Eager to know or learn something.

crying.name: Crying
crying.description: Shedding tears, typically from sorrow or distress.

angry.name: Angry
angry.description: Feeling or showing strong annoyance or hostility.

frustrated.name: Frustrated
frustrated.description: Feeling or expressing distress due to inability to achieve goals.

exhausted.name: Exhausted
exhausted.description: Extremely tired, drained of energy or resources.

weary.name: Weary
weary.description: Feeling or showing extreme tiredness, especially after hard work.

overwhelmed.name: Overwhelmed
overwhelmed.description: Feeling buried or drowned beneath a huge mass of something.

fearful.name: Fearful
fearful.description: Feeling afraid or showing fear or anxiety.

worried.name: Worried
worried.description: Anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems.

distressed.name: Distressed
distressed.description: Suffering extreme anxiety, sorrow, or pain.

disappointed.name: Disappointed
disappointed.description: Sad or displeased because expectations weren't met.

anguished.name: Anguished
anguished.description: Experiencing severe mental or physical pain or suffering.

vulnerable.name: Vulnerable
vulnerable.description: Exposed to possible harm, either physically or emotionally.
